subject: Baseball
Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The owner Tom Hicks said he is looking for investors to purchase minority interests in two of his professional sports teams — baseball’s Texas Rangers and hockey’s Dallas Stars. At the Rangers’ spring training site, Hicks said he was willing to let limited partners purchase up to 49 percent of each club, leaving him with a controlling interest. Hicks said he owned 95 percent of both teams. One potential buyer is Nolan Ryan, who was hired as the Rangers’ president in February 2008.
